channel.title: Laptop
channel.description: I need a laptop Im getting one for Christmas.. So pick me out what you think is the best. I want decent ram and harddrive. Don't worry about the operating system, Ill use ubuntu.. I don't really game. And I don't have loads of MP3's So Im not gonna need a extreme haddrive.

item.title: Laptop
item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:15, topic:159435”][quote author=mrrules link=topic=217106.msg1892874#msg1892874 date=1195802476]

Don’t touch a dell. Listen to Davidude.

Lol I bet you a dell is better then the computer you have…

Dont talk when you don’t know what your talking about.
[/quote]

Rofl, I’ve built/repaired more computers than you’ve seen. Dells are like computers from PCWorld, overpriced hunks of junk. Now, assuming you know nothing about computer parts (which you clearly don’t or you’d know the following) Dells contain cheap parts, usually the mobo, RAM and GFX cards.They have the low end processors and they wont last for than a year or two before they come way out of date. Now, you probably own a Dell and are therefore acting like a fanboy, telling me I know nothing about it because your insulted by the truth, in any case, you’ve wasted your money.

Oh and on the comment about my computer being worse than a dell. My current computer was built (by me) 8 months ago, Dell has only just brought one out with a similar spec and it costs over £1000 (8 months later!). My laptop I got around 2 years ago and is better than the majority still in stores today, please as you said to me, don’t talk about something you know nothing about.

On a small note, during my part time work in a computer store, about 50% of repairs we did were on Dells.[/quote]
Lol… Ive been around computers all my life , because my uncle builds them for a living and I lived with them all my life.

Heard of the company Cannon?

Yea my dads a robotic Engineer and ive repaired many of there computers in the toner plants and shops (no idea how to spell that)

So you can’t say you repaired more computers then ive seen.

Go back to your little nerd computer store and act like you can repair a computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“mrrules, post:13, topic:159435”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=217106.msg1889854#msg1889854 date=1195687811]
Don’t touch a dell. Listen to Davidude.
[/quote]
Lol I bet you a dell is better then the computer you have…

Dont talk when you don’t know what your talking about.[/quote]

Rofl, I’ve built/repaired more computers than you’ve seen. Dells are like computers from PCWorld, overpriced hunks of junk. Now, assuming you know nothing about computer parts (which you clearly don’t or you’d know the following) Dells contain cheap parts, usually the mobo, RAM and GFX cards.They have the low end processors and they wont last for than a year or two before they come way out of date. Now, you probably own a Dell and are therefore acting like a fanboy, telling me I know nothing about it because your insulted by the truth, in any case, you’ve wasted your money.

Oh and on the comment about my computer being worse than a dell. My current computer was built (by me) 8 months ago, Dell has only just brought one out with a similar spec and it costs over £1000 (8 months later!). My laptop I got around 2 years ago and is better than the majority still in stores today, please as you said to me, don’t talk about something you know nothing about.

On a small note, during my part time work in a computer store, about 50% of repairs we did were on Dells.

Read full topic

item.description:

What exactly will you be using it for?

Just a personal computer. Uhm Im not excatly sure…

Greeny:

Laptops with large HDD capacities don’t exist unfortunately. Just buy an external HDD in conjunction with a well speced laptop.

I said I don’t want one with a large HD
